item.description: üìö Social networks aren‚Äôt the problem, ignorance is. Carl Sagan called it 30 years ago. So if you are annoyed by Twitter‚Äôs overall tone maybe schools are more to blame than we admit, on all sides and at all levels of education? https://t.co/TgZnrRVlzb

@NTallapragada @patrickc The mantra used to be that industry goes for quick gains while academics are pursuing long-term, seemingly unreachable goals. Doubt that's ever been completely true, but now it's quite obviously turned on its head.

üìö Five months into the year, and I‚Äôve abandoned my first book: The Ministry for the Future. Broad strokes and cipher characters √† la Three Body Problem just didn‚Äôt go well with the specific issues The Ministry‚Ä¶ was trying to raise.
@AaronGoodman33 @AleckAmalia No, podcasting is great for ego deflation ‚Äî just start reading the comments!

Two excellent episodes of Healthcare Unfiltered üéô in two weeks: Aaron Goodman on heme malignancies. Amer Zeidan on MDS and AML. More podcasts with both would be a very good thing. Highly recommended! https://t.co/VvSZpzT0W2
